intro: Randia keniae, commonly known as the Kenia randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Randia keniae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
